metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14424 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The daemon in GDM through 3.29.1 does not properly unexport display objects from its D-Bus interface when they are destroyed, which allows a local attacker to trigger a use-after-free via a specially crafted sequence of D-Bus method calls, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-14424` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdm3 - 3.29.91-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-gdm-1.0 - 3.29.91-1ubuntu1
libgdm1 - 3.29.91-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdm3 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.29.91-1ubuntu1').
